snippet: The company warned it expected to post a fourth consecutive annual loss, of $2.9 billion, as sluggish sales and natural disasters weighed on its bottom line.
abstract: Sony warns it expects to post a fourth consecutive annual loss, of $2.9 billion, as sluggish sales and natural disasters weighed on its bottom line; analysts say staging a turnaround at the firm will be a daunting task for new chief Kazuo Hirai.
lead_paragraph: The company warned it expected to post a fourth consecutive annual loss, of $2.9 billion, as sluggish sales and natural disasters weighed on its bottom line.

headline.main: Incoming Chief Takes On a Sony That Is a Shadow of Its Former Self
headline.print_headline: Incoming Sony Chief Inherits a Diminished Company
